cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE. 

The paper proposes an innovative approach to machine reading comprehension (MRC) that uses explicit knowledge to assist the prediction of answer spans. This approach involves a WordNet-based data enrichment method and an MRC model named Knowledge Aided Reader (KAR). The paper falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML), which are covered by several arXiv CS sub-categories. Given the focus on NLP and ML, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers topics related to NLP, including text classification, information retrieval, and question answering. Other likely sub-categories include cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which covers topics related to ML and AI, cs.LG (Machine Learning), which covers topics related to ML algorithms and models, cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which covers topics related to search engines and text retrieval, and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which covers topics related to neural networks and evolutionary algorithms.
